wikipedia_page.main:
Deborah Bampton, MBE, (born 7 October 1961) is an English former international footballer who played as a midfielder. During her career Bampton won a treble at Arsenal and two doubles with Croydon. She also was capped a sum of 95 times for England, scoring seven goals all in all.Bampton was appointed an MBE in 1998 as a recognition of her services to women's football.
She also went on to be inducted into the English Football Hall of Fame in 2005.
